moves.1. e4 c5 2. Bc4 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nf3 Nf: I earned a small advantage here, and I should have played conservatively at this point, but I didn't ...
moves.7. Qf3 d5 8. Bd3 Nf6:
1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nxc6 bxc6 6. Bc4 Nxe4 7. Qf3 d5 8. Bd3 Nf6
B33: Sicilian defence
This was a crazy gambit that most definitely did not pay off in the end.  I should have retreated the g4 bishop and developed my f8 bishop and maybe put myself into a castle O-O.
moves.14. c3 Qb6 15. fxg4 Qxb2 16. Qa6: This is a brilliant counter-attack by white (and should have been obvious to me when I made my gambit).  This forced me to reconsider my attack on the rook and results in me getting all out of position to keep the queen off my king.

19.	O-O 	Qxa2
moves.17. Qxc6+ Kf7 18. Qxd5+ e6 19. Qxa8 Qxa1: I missed this.  This was the straw that broke the camel's back.
